docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: Welcome to the workshop for streaming ThousandEyes data to Splunk using OpenTelemetry. This workshop will guide you through setting up integrations between ThousandEyes and Splunk, enabling you to visualize and analyze network monitoring data effectively.

docs.title: Goals
docs.text:
By the end of this workshop, you will:

  • Set up ThousandEyes HTTP Server tests.
  • Stream ThousandEyes telemetry data to both Splunk Observability Cloud and Splunk Enterprise.
  • Visualize network and application data using Splunk dashboards.
  • Explore the advanced capabilities of the Cisco ThousandEyes App for Splunk.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Access to ThousandEyes and Splunk accounts.
  • Familiarity with Postman.

docs.title: Agenda
docs.text:
• Workshop Guide:
    • Step 1. Access Postman
    • Step 2. Create ThousandEyes HTTP Server test
    • Step 3. Stream to Splunk Observability Cloud
      • Step 3.a. Create Streaming integration on ThousandEyes for Splunk Observability Cloud
      • Step 3.b. Access Splunk Observability Cloud
      • Step 3.c. Visualize ThousandEyes telemetry data in Splunk Observability Cloud
    • Step 4. Stream to Splunk Enterprise
      • Step 4.a. Create Streaming integration on ThousandEyes for Splunk Enterprise
      • Step 4.b. Access Splunk Enterprise
      • Step 4.c. Visualize ThousandEyes telemetry data in Splunk Enterprise
  • Bonus Section - Splunk App
    • Step 1. Navigate to Cisco ThousandEyes App for Splunk
    • Step 2. Create stream test input
    • Step 3. Network and Application dashboards
    • Step 4. Create activity log input
    • Step 5. Activity logs dashboards

docs.title: Access Postman
docs.text:
Choose one of the following options to access Postman:

Login to Existing AccountFree Trial

If you already have a Postman account:

  • Navigate to Postman Login
  • Enter your credentials to sign in

If you don't have a Postman account:

  • Navigate to Postman Sign Up
  • Create a new account with your email
  • Follow the verification process
  • Access Postman with your new account

docs.title: Import Workspace
docs.text:
Once you have access to Postman:

  • Import workspace
  • Navigate to Workspaces and select the new workspace

  • Verify the collection ThousandEyesSplunkIntegration is loaded, including requests and variables.

docs.title: Cisco ThousandEyes App for Splunk
docs.text:
The Cisco ThousandEyes App for Splunk enables collectos and analyze:

  • CEA (Cloud and Enterprise Agent) and Endpoint test results data
  • Event and
  • Activity logs

docs.title: Step 1. Navigate to Cisco ThousandEyes App for Splunk
docs.text:
• Once we are logged into Splunk Enterprise Step 7. Login into Splunk Enterprise
  • Navigate to Cisco ThousandEyes App for Splunk
  • In the app, you will find out: configuration, inputs, search and dashboards. Check the ThousandEyes documentation

docs.title: Step 2. Create stream test input
docs.text:
• In inputs section
  • Click Create New Input, select Tests Stream
  • Fill the form:
    • Name: unique name, you can use test_<seat>. For example test_1
    • ThousandEyes User: select you user
    • Account Group: selec your account
    • Cloud & Enterprise Agent Tests: select your HTTP test
    • HEC Token: select DEVWKS-2656
    • Test Index: select default

docs.title: Step 3. Network and Application dashboards
docs.text:
• In the dashboards section, select Network
  • In the dashboards section, select Application

docs.title: Step 4. Create activity log input
docs.text:
• In inputs section
  • Click Create New Input, select Activity
  • Fill the form:
    • Name: unique name, you can use activity_<seat>. For example activity_1
    • ThousandEyes User: select you user
    • Account Group: selec your account
    • Index: select default

docs.title: Step 5. Activity logs dashboards
docs.text: • In the dashboards section, select Activity Logs

docs.title: Create ThousandEyes Streams to Splunk Observability Cloud
Create Metrics Streams on ThousandEyes for Splunk Observability Cloud
docs.text:
Choose one of the following methods to create your stream to Splunk Observability Cloud:

API MethodUI Method

Use the ThousandEyes API through Postman to create the stream programmatically.

Use the ThousandEyes web interface to create the integration manually via OpenTelemetry.

To integrate Splunk Observability Cloud with ThousandEyes, follow these steps:

Receiving data

The stream will begin sending data to Splunk Observability Cloud in a couple of minutes.

docs.title: Create Stream via API
docs.text:
• Open the Create metrics stream - Splunk Observability request in your Postman collection
  • Review the request body and ensure all required fields are configured:
  • Click Send to execute the API request

docs.title: Verify Stream Creation
docs.text:
• Check the API response for successful stream creation
  • Note the stream ID from the response for future reference
  • The stream will begin sending data to Splunk Observability Cloud

API Documentation

For detailed API parameters and options, check the ThousandEyes API documentation.

docs.title: Navigate to Integrations
docs.text:
• Log in to your account on the ThousandEyes platform
  • Go to Manage > Integration > Integration 1.0
  • Click New Integration and select OpenTelemetry Integration

docs.title: Configure Basic Settings
docs.text:
• Enter a Name for the integration (e.g., "Splunk Observability Cloud Integration")
  • Set the Target to HTTP

docs.title: Configure Endpoint
docs.text:
• Enter the Endpoint URL to send data in OTLP (OpenTelemetry Protocol) format: 
    https://ingest.{REALM}.signalfx.com/v2/datapoint/otlp
  • Replace {REALM} with your Splunk environment such as us1, eu0, us0
  • For Preset Configuration, select Splunk Observability Cloud

docs.title: Configure Authentication
docs.text:
• For Auth Type, select Custom
  • Add the following Custom Headers:
    • X-SF-Token: {TOKEN} - Enter your Splunk Observability Cloud access token
    • Content-Type: application/x-protobuf

docs.title: Configure Data Settings
docs.text:
• Select Metric as the OpenTelemetry Signal
  • Select v2 as the Data Model Version
  • Select a test that you want to stream data from

docs.title: Save and Activate
docs.text:
• Click Save to complete the integration setup
  • Your ThousandEyes data should now be successfully integrated with Splunk Observability Cloud

Test Selection

For more information on creating a test, see the previous step or General Setup Instructions.

docs.title: Create ThousandEyes Page Load Test
docs.text:
For ThousandEyes to be able to stream data to Splunk, the data first needs to be collected by ThousandEyes. To achieve this, we need to create a ThousandEyes test. Refer to ThousandEyes documentation for test creation.

We are going to create a Page Load test that validates the availability of www.google.com.

Choose one of the following methods to create your test:

API MethodUI Method

Use the ThousandEyes API through Postman to create the test programmatically.

Use the ThousandEyes web interface to create the test manually.

docs.title: Create Test via API
docs.text:
• Open the Create ThousandEyes Page Load Test request in your Postman collection
  • Click Send to execute the API request

docs.title: Copy Test ID
docs.text:
• Copy the testId from the API response

Agent Selection

You can use different agentId values using the ThousandEyes API List Agents. See more info for details.

Full description of the API request is available at ThousandEyes API Reference.

docs.title: Create Test via UI
docs.text:
• In the ThousandEyes dashboard, click Test Settings
  • Click the + Add New Test button
  • Select Page Load from the test type options

docs.title: Configure Test Settings
docs.text:
• Test Name: Enter a descriptive name (e.g., "Google Page Load Test")
  • URL: Enter https://www.google.com
  • In the Agents section, select one or more Cloud Agents
  • Choose agents from different geographic locations for better coverage
  • Click Create New Test

docs.title: Get Test ID
docs.text:
• After creating the test, click on the test name to view details
  • In the URL bar, note the Test ID number (e.g., /tests/12345)
  • Copy this Test ID for use in Postman variables

docs.title: Save the Test ID in Postman
docs.text:
• In Postman, go to your collection Variables
  • Find the ThousandEyes_test_id variable
  • Paste the test ID in the Current Value field
  • Click Save

docs.title: Distributed Tracing - Service Map - Splunk Observabiltiy
Get ThousandEyes Agent Id for the creation of the ThousandEyes HTTP test
docs.text: When creation the ThousandEyes HTTP test you may see an error related to the agent. We can use a different agentId.

docs.title: Search for a new agentId
docs.text:
• Use the following Postman request to get the agents
  • In the resposne, search for an agent
    • E.g Barcelona
  • Save the agentId into the variable ThousandEyes_agent_id in Postman

docs.title: Login to Splunk Observability Cloud
docs.text: This guide will help you log into Splunk Observability Cloud and obtain an access token for the ThousandEyes integration.

docs.title: Choose Your Access Method
docs.text:
Existing AccountFree Trial

If you already have a Splunk Observability Cloud account:

If you don't have a Splunk Observability Cloud account:

docs.title: Login to Your Account
docs.text:
• Navigate to Splunk Observability Cloud
  • Enter your email address and password
  • Click Sign In

docs.title: Start Free Trial
docs.text:
• Navigate to Splunk Observability Cloud Free Trial
  • Click Start Free Trial or Try Free
  • Fill out the registration form with your business information:
    • First Name and Last Name
    • Business Email Address
    • Company Name
    • Phone Number
    • Country/Region

docs.title: Verify Your Account
docs.text:
• Check your email for a verification message
  • Click the verification link to activate your account
  • Complete your profile setup
  • Access your new Splunk Observability Cloud dashboard

docs.title: Generate Access Token
docs.text: Once you're logged into Splunk Observability Cloud, follow these steps to generate your access token:

docs.title: Navigate to Access Token Settings
docs.text:
• Click on your profile icon in the top-right corner
  • Select Organization Settings from the dropdown menu
  • In the left navigation, click on Access Tokens

docs.title: Create New Access Token
docs.text:
• Click + New Token button
  • Configure the token settings:
    • Token Name: Enter a descriptive name (e.g., "ThousandEyes Integration Token")
    • Token Description: Optional description for the token's purpose
    • Token Type: Select INGEST (required for receiving data from ThousandEyes)
    • Permissions: The INGEST type automatically has the correct permissions

docs.title: Generate and Copy Token
docs.text:
• Click OK to generate the token
  • Copy the token immediately - it will only be displayed once
  • Store the token securely (you'll need it for Postman configuration)

docs.title: Note Your Realm
docs.text:
• While in the Access Tokens section, note your Realm information
  • Your realm is visible in the URL or in the organization settings (e.g., us0, us1, eu0)
  • You'll need this realm information for the ThousandEyes integration

docs.title: Add Token to Postman Variables
docs.text: Now that you have your Splunk Observability Cloud access token, add it to your Postman collection variables:

docs.title: Open Collection Variables
docs.text:
• In Postman, navigate to your ThousandEyes Splunk Integration collection
  • Go to the Variables tab

docs.title: Set the Splunk Access Token Variable
docs.text:
• Find the variable named Splunk_access_token in the list
  • In the Current Value column, paste your Splunk access token
  • Find the variable named Splunk_Observability_realm in the list
  • In the Current Value column, enter your Splunk realm (e.g., us0, us1, eu0)
  • Click Save to apply the changes

docs.title: Login to ThousandEyes
docs.text:
Choose one of the following options to access ThousandEyes:

Existing AccountFree Trial

If you already have a ThousandEyes account:

  • Navigate to ThousandEyes Login
  • Go to ThousandEyes Login
  • Enter your email address and password
  • Click Sign In

If you don't have a ThousandEyes account:

  • Start Free Trial
  • Navigate to ThousandEyes Free Trial
  • Fill out the registration form with your business information
  • Verify your email address

docs.title: Get ThousandEyes Bearer Token
docs.text: Once you're logged into ThousandEyes, follow these steps to generate your API bearer token:

docs.title: Navigate to User Profile
docs.text:
• Click on your profile icon in the top-right corner of the ThousandEyes dashboard
  • Select Account Settings from the dropdown menu
  • Navigate to Users and Roles → Profile

docs.title: Generate API Token
docs.text:
• Scroll down to the API Tokens section
  • Click Generate API Token button
  • Copy the token immediately - it will only be displayed once
  • Store the token securely (you'll need it for the next step)

docs.title: Add Token to Postman Variables
docs.text: Now that you have your ThousandEyes bearer token, add it to your Postman collection variables:

docs.title: Open Collection Variables
docs.text:
• In Postman, navigate to your ThousandEyes Splunk Integration collection
  • Click on the collection to open its settings
  • Go to the Variables tab

docs.title: Set the ThousandEyes_token Variable
docs.text:
• Find the variable named ThousandEyes_token in the list
  • In the Current Value column, paste your bearer token
  • Click Save to apply the changes

docs.title: Step 4.a. Create Streaming integration on ThousandEyes for Splunk Enterprise
docs.text:
• Create a stream integration for Splunk Enterprise. Check the ThousandEyes API documentation.
  • Use Create Streaming Integration - Splunk Enterprise Postman request to create the stream

docs.title: Step 4.b. Access Splunk Enterprise
docs.text:
• Navigate to Splunk Enterprise
    • Username: antonjim+devnet<seat>@cisco.com (e.g. antonjim+devnet1@cisco.com)
    • Password: ``

docs.title: Step 4.c. Visualize ThousandEyes telemetry data in Splunk Enterprise
docs.text:
• In the initial page of Splunk Enterprise
  • Navigate to Search & Reporting
  • Navigate to Dashboards
  • Select DEVWKS-2656
  • Visualize the data

docs.title: Visualize ThousandEyes data in Splunk Observability Cloud
visualize ThousandEyes data in Splunk Observability Cloud
Access Splunk Observability Cloud
docs.text:
• Navigate to Splunk Observability Cloud
    • Email: antonjim+devnet<seat>@cisco.com
      • (e.g. antonjim+devnet1@cisco.com)
    • Password: ``

docs.title: Visualize ThousandEyes telemetry data in Splunk Observability Cloud
docs.text:
• In the initial page of Splunk Observability Cloud
  • Navigate to Dashboards
  • In Custom dashboard groups, expand DEVWKS-2656 and select Application
  • Visualize the data
